required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Expert Behaviors in Ultrasound Guided Regional Anesthesia A Mixed-Methods Study

brief_summary.textblock: Expert-performance begins by focusing specifically on the end-product of training and experience in the hands of the expert. By defining expert behaviors and techniques, investigators can guide learners and non-expert practitioners by offering them models to emulate. At Toronto Western Hospital (TWH), there are more than ten expert attending regional anesthesiologists who routinely provide clinical patient care in the block room. The primary objective of this study is to qualitatively and quantitatively examine behavior of experts performing ultrasound guided regional anesthesia techniques to identify those which are consistent and unique, and which may underpin expert performance.

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative behaviors of experts performing UGRA techniques during pre-procedural discussion
primary_outcome.description: Reviewers will identify behaviors exhibited by the expert operators during pre-procedural discussion

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative behaviors of experts performing UGRA techniques during patient and equipment preparation
primary_outcome.description: Reviewers will identify behaviors exhibited by the expert operators during patient and equipment preparation

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative behaviours of experts performing UGRA techniques during ultrasound scanning of the target area;
primary_outcome.description: Reviewers will identify behaviors exhibited by the expert operators during ultrasound scanning of the target area;

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative behaviours of experts performing UGRA techniques during needle advancement and local anesthetic deposition around the target nerve(s)
primary_outcome.description: Reviewers will identify behaviors exhibited by the expert operators during needle advancement and local anesthetic deposition around the target nerve(s).

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative data on block effectiveness defined by blocks requiring top-up
primary_outcome.description: number of top-up will be collected

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative data on block effectiveness defined by blocks requiring conversion to GA
primary_outcome.description: Incidence will be documented in case conversion to GA is needed

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative data on time to surgical anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: defined by final needle removal to surgical anesthesia

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative data on time to block completion
primary_outcome.description: defined by needle insertion to final needle removal

study_pop.textblock:
This is a mixed methods assessment study to be completed at TWH. We will recruit 10 fellowship-trained regional anesthesiology and pain medicine staff anesthesiologists to perform USGRA blocks while being video-recorded. Here, we specifically define expert as a staff anesthesiologist who has completed a fellowship in regional anesthesia and/or chronic pain and has at least 6-years of post-fellowship clinical experience with USGRA.
Consent will also be sought from 180 patients undergoing USGRA for surgical procedures at TWH to have the block completed by an expert, as previously defined, and to have the procedure recorded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All elective patients coming to the regional BR at TWH aged 18-80
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any contraindication to USGRA (LA allergy, patient refusal, infection at injection site, etc.)
- Inability to read or speak or comprehend English fluently
